CommentBody: Customer has NEA installed on a standalone server (not domain joined). We created a client secret for authentication of NEA and also created self-signed certificate for SharePoint jobs. These jobs are running fine after mentioned configurations, but bulk import jobs aren't working. We are getting errors referencing DB tables that aren't present in the DB as verified from SSMS. However, in my lab environment everything is working fine and I see the tables that arent present in Customer's DB.

Thread open - Can SPO scan work without on prem DC? (this customer does not have on prem AD).
Does SpSEEK still also do SPAA collection (as historically) if so then can it be documented.
Documentation on the job dependencies.  SPAA requires Entra ID and ADI? etc

On Escalation Ticket # 00424603 the new comment has been added: Chris Brooks:

@Salesforce Hi Pasan,
In the past, we've worked around this issue by renaming the domain controller from ADI to "None" (See screenshot "ADIDC" in "From Dev" folder.
This might also be required if there is a change file for the job.
Then there are the two create scripts in the "From Dev" folder in the "ADI_Scripts" that can be run to build the necessary tables in SQL.
Once done you should be able to run the SPO scans with all the necessary AD tables now built. I'll work on getting this as a KB and create a ticket for a long-term solution in the product.

[DevOps CommentId:11114789]
